techmeme.title: Spotify begins piloting parent-managed accounts for kids under 13 on family plans in select markets, including Denmark, New Zealand, and Sweden (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
Sources: the European Commission is poised to conclude X does not fall under its Digital Markets Act, after a probe found X's impact on EU markets is too small (Samuel Stolton/Bloomberg)
Sources: CoreWeave is in talks to sell existing shares, valuing it at $23B, up from $19.1B in May 2024; shareholders, such as employees, may sell $400M to $500M (Bloomberg)
United Airlines plans to start testing Starlink internet service in early 2025, with the first passenger flights likely equipped with free Wi-Fi later in 2025 (Wall Street Journal)
Meta restarts training its AI systems on UK users' public Facebook and Instagram posts, having "incorporated regulatory feedback" to be "even more transparent" (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
